Entries.default:
[Specified 0] whistles from high in the rigging and points frantically to port. "Look, captain! Look!"

Your crew gathers to peer into the distance.
"I'm going aboard."
"Continue on our course."
[Specified 2] salutes. "Aye, captain. Probably for the best. No telling what's lying in wait out there."
The crew ready the skiff, and you oar your way across the ocean swells towards the listing junk.
"Fire the cannons. Scare those creatures away."
The shot arcs over the junk's deck and whizzes past its hull, splashing into the water all around the wreck.

[Player Ship] shudders as the cannons fire. 

Unfortunately, a few shots crash through the hull, just beneath the waterline.
You reach the ship safely and scale the side of the ship...
The crew ready the skiff, and you oar your way across the ocean swells towards the listing junk.
As you approach, the lagufaeth hiss and gurgle at you from the deck. A few produce blowguns and quickly fill the air with a rain of brightly-feathered darts.

From behind you, [SkillCheck 0] cries out. You look back to see your companion pull a feathered needle the length of a dagger from between the ribs. You take the dart and throw it into the water as [SkillCheck 0] attends to the bleeding.

One of the darts strikes you, punching through gear and skin alike. You tear it from your flesh and throw the dagger-length projectile overboard. You clasp a hand over the wound, and blood seeps from between your fingers.
The darts pelt the skiff, but none of them strike you.
[Use spyglass.]
"Bring us closer. I want a better look."
You look out upon the ship, a ruined junk sporting faded Deadfire Company colors. The sails hang limp and shredded, and cracks mar the barnacle-spotted planks.

[Specified 1] salutes. "Aye, captain."

Rigging tightens and sails creek as [Player Ship] approaches the unknown vessel.

The ship slowly looms closer, a ruined junk sporting faded Deadfire Company colors. The sails hang limp and shredded, and cracks mar the barnacle-spotted planks.
A lanky, agile creature scales the side of the ship, its four arms hauling it over the railing and onto the deck. The movement, you realize, is that of a pack of lagufaeth that have swarmed the junk.

Eyes shielded with an open palm, [Specified 1] squints. "Stranded ship, captain. There's movement. Might be survivors."

You look. Dark shapes move above the weathered hull.

"Big old junk like that," [Specified 2] mutters, "could have some nice guns. Who knows what else."
[Leave it be.]
"Prepare the cannons. Send it to the ocean's floor."
[Terrify them with an ability.]

"With what? We don't have any cannonballs."

[Specified 2] coughs.
The lagufaeth under your baleful gaze, you pour forth essence in a potent blast of pure horror.
[Specified 5] nods to you, then focuses on the far ship. After a few moments of concentration, your follower releases a torrential outpouring of concentrated fear.
With a grating chorus of screeches and hisses, the sea creatures flee the deck, diving over the rails to vanish into the depths.
"I'm going aboard."
[Player Ship] shivers as the guns blaze, sending balls of lead through the stranded junk.

[Player Ship] releases a volley of lead balls that crash harmlessly into the water.

The light breeze carries the screeching and hissing of the lagufaeth on deck.

The lagufaeth leap from the deck and vanish into the water.

You watch as the ship rolls over and sinks beneath the waves.

[Specified 2] grins. "My pleasure, captain." 

With a bevy of shouted orders, the cannoneer vanishes into the hold.

[Specified 2] snaps to attention. "Aye, captain. It's your lead to waste."

With a bevy of shouted orders, the cannoneer vanishes into the hold.
The skiff bumps against the junk, and you scale the side of the lagufaeth-infested ship...
